title: New Arabic ligatures from existing ones by adding diacritics
content:
I have got an OpenType Arabic font with a good number of ligatures. But some characters that share the same body with others with a different number/placement of diacritics (dots etc.) do not have the ligatures that those others have. I want to create those ligatures by duplicating an existing ligature glyph and changing or adding diacritics with Fontlab Studio 5. I tried to do this intuitively, added those characters in substitution features, but the resulting font became unusable with letters not joining. What am I supposed to do?

 [‹ No kerning in InDesign but ok in Corel](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044942/http:/typophile.com/node/34933 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for information on raster/bitmap fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044942/http:/typophile.com/node/34849 "Go to next forum topic")
author: typotype

comments.content:
You need to add OpenType Layout code into your font that performs the ligature substitutions.

A.
It didn’t work as intended. See [http://typophile.com/node/34998](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044942/http:/typophile.com/node/34998 "http://typophile.com/node/34998")
